content.description: A very fun boulder problem on small crimps sets you up for a big move out right to gain the edge of the roof. Traverse left on huge chicken heads along the edge of the roof to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Left of the Dark Matter Wall beneath a large roof.

content.description: Route climbs up the left bolt line of a beautiful prow that is shared with the ultra classic Cosmic Cowboy.  A bouldery start with good feet gets you up to the overhang section where better holds but steep climbing await.  Keep moving as rests are hard to come by...
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with chains that is shared with Cosmic Cowboy
content.location: Route is on the large prow on the Southern end of Fern North area.  The route climbs the left of 2 bolt lines running up the prow to shared anchors.  The prow is just left of Dark Matter wall which is a distinct dark brown color.

content.description: This short route will test your crimp strength.  If you can find it dry, jump on it, because it likely won't be dry next time you come out.
content.location: If you're coming from Main area, this will be the first set of routes you will come to as you head North.  This is the left route on the dark brown streak on the wall.

content.description:
Sloper pockets all the way up. 

  Check the Fern climbing guide book for more info and locations:  

fernclimbing.com/guide-book…
content.location: 15 feet left of the cave with Buck Rogers.

content.description: Good crimps end at the first bolt. Fist bolt is kinda high but the holds are larger after that and theres a slightly overhanging finish.
Great for a beginning lead or a warm up. Scramble up to a ledge stickclip the first bolt if you don't feel comfortable. Huge jugs up the wall to the overhanging finish.

Sparse holds for the first 10 feet lead to big slopers before the first bolt. The direct start is the crux, which you might skip if you start too far to the right near Space Cadets. 

  Check the Fern climbing guide book for more info and locations:  

fernclimbing.com/guide-book…
content.location: ~30 feet left of the cave with Buck Rogers.

content.description: Start on a flake and climb over a bulge to low anchors.

Follow a thin seam on the border between the dark and light section of wall.  Use a few pockets to work your way up to the top edge.  You can either top out or work your way up and left along the top edge to the anchors on Orion.  Backup your placements in the seam as they don't inspire confidence.
content.protection: 1 cam and a couple of small offset nuts is all you'll get on this thin seam.  You may be able to work a small X4 cam into the seam towards the top.
content.location: Climbs the seam that splits the white and dark brown rock on the Dark Matter wall.

content.description:
There are a few areas with small holds. The start has some small crimps before a rewarding jug. Overhang moves toward the top. 

  Bolts trend left, but it seems that the arete is intended to be used a little for right hands. 

  Check the Fern climbing guide book for more info and locations:  

fernclimbing.com/guide-book…
content.location: Overhanging face climb just right of Buck Rogers cave. TR falls can swing into a large tree near the start.

content.description: This is the right route that climbs up the dark brown patch of rock on the aptly named Dark Matter wall.  Climb straight up the bolt line and don't stray too far right.  The crux is moving past the 2nd bolt using a weird left nubbin and moving to a decent right hand that may be hard to see.  After that you are one big move away from a stellar ledge just below the chains.  If you come across this route when it's dry, you better jump on it.
content.protection: 2 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: On the path to Fern North there is an obvious dark brown patch of wall.  This is the rightmost route on that patch.

content.description: Description:   Route climbs up the right of 2 bolt lines of a large prow. A sloping crimp gets you to the 1st bolt then easy but pumpy climbing on good jugs over sometimes questionable rock gets you to the crux which is throwing for a massive pocket jug while pulling over the roof. One or two more moves and you are clipping the chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor with chains. Anchor is shared with Weeping Rodeo Clown.
content.location: Route is on the large prow on the Southern end of the Fern North area. The route climbs the right of 2 bolt lines running up the prow to shared anchors. The obvious prow is about 20 yards left of the Dark Matter wall which is a distinct dark brown color.

content.description: Blunt arete has hollow holds and sparse gear. Be careful on this one.
Slightly left leaning wide crack that starts in a small cave.
content.protection: No anchors. SR with big cams
content.location: End of the formation up creek from Cellulite

content.description: This splitter is the best moderate trad route at Fern.
content.location: about 2-3 minutes upstream of the P.K. Boulder. on the West side of the creek.

content.description: This section of Fern only has 7 listed climbs in it, and all but one are on the east side of the creek. But don't let the low number deter you. All 7 are great climbs.
